name: Estuary Boroughs
role_in_state: Maritime trade, transshipment and navigational-augury hub
economy_niches: small- to medium-vessel shipbuilding and repair
paid navigational-augury services for coastal voyagers
culture_adjustments: Stronger clan control of slips and harbor rights than hinterland
Blends Coastal Tongues with Riveric Dialect loan-forms in trade argot
Higher ritualization of tide-watching and channel-charms
Seasonal migrant labor increases multicultural temporary settlements
Practical tolerance for salvage and informal privateering
constraints: Tidal channels limit vessel size and heavy industry
Ritual-augury services consume scarce imported reagents
Seasonal (monsoonal) labor cycles constrain year-round production
notes: Constant dredging and channel-charms required; guilds control dredge-licenses
Harbor law enforced by borough courts and clan arbitrators
Saltworks and curers concentrate downwind; strong odor zones near estuary mouth
